intro: Calotheca cuspidata, commonly known as the spiky calotheca, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. The plant's unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important component of its native habitats.
